ovdesc.p: The PORTFOLIO.CONSTRAINT application enables the control of exposure to a particular issuer by portfolio.

Contraints may be set-up for individual portfolios but you should also set-up a basic default record for "SYSTEM". For the "SYSTEM" record you can only set-up checking to be performed so that transaction proceeds are added to other existing holdings for the same issuer. The result is then tested as a percentage of the total portfolio value.

For portfolios, you can request the System to perform the checks using either specific currency/cash amounts OR percentages of the total portfolio value by individual issuer. The former checks that the total existing holding for the issuer plus the new transaction does not exceed the limit amount. The latter checks that the total holding for the issuer plus the new transaction does not exceed the limit percentage of the total portfolio value.
When you have successfully defined a portfolio limit, you can add further special siuation limits for the same portfolios if necessary.

This field specifies the Issuer to whom the limit per issuer is to apply.
The last value of this multi-valued field must be "REST" which denotes the rest of issuers not specified in this record.
"REST" or
1 to 10 digit CUSTOMER id
This field specifies the maximum percentage of a particular Issuer which can be held in a customer's portfolio.
Value 0 means the Issuer is blocked from the customer's portfolio, whereas, value 100 means no check is to be performed for this Issuer within this portfolio.
1 - 3 numeric characters in the range of 0 to 100
NOINPUT field if ISSUER.EXPOSURE is defined.

2 character field Acceptable values are :- EQ - equal to NE - not equal to LT - less than LE - less than or equal to GT - greater than GE - greater than or equal to
Specifies a unique ID for each PORTFOLIO.CONSTRAINT record. It comprises a portfolio number and an optional serial number.
The serial number is used to differentiate multiple PORTFOLIO.CONSTRAINT records of the same customer's portfolio. For example: 65435-1.01 (bond trading) 65435-1.02 (new issues)
A special ID - "SYSTEM" is also allowed to facilitate user specifying a system wide portfolio constraint.
"SYSTEM" or
(a) 1 - 18 digit SEC.ACC.MASTER id (b) '.' (c) 2 digit serial number.
Serial number must be between 01 and 99.
